SENT.plain: Antegrade aortic perfusion is preferable in arch and descending aortic operations
We describe a left lateral approach using an ascending aortic cannula, temporarily relocated within the distal aorta to maintain hypothermic cardiopulmonary bypass of the lower torso
This modification provides continual antegrade systemic perfusion and passive retrograde cerebral flow during arch repair
It minimizes the risk of embolization into the brachiocephalic arteries of debris and malperfusion of the dissected aorta
